Ad Text:
The Opportunity

Ventia's Group Supply Chain team is excited to offer a new opportunity for a Senior Supply Chain Solutions Lead. In this key leadership role, you will be responsible for shaping and delivering strategic supply chain initiatives that ensure the timely, cost-effective availability of goods and services from our suppliers.

Working in a dynamic and evolving technical environment, you will lead cross-functional projects that enhance operational efficiency, improve supplier performance, and unlock long-term commercial value. Your expertise will be crucial in integrating diverse systems and streamlining processes, enabling smooth transitions, scalable operations, and future-ready supply chain capabilities.

What's in it for you?

Competitive salary package
Flexible work arrangements to support work-life balance
An exciting opportunity to shape the development of innovative solutions across ‘s Group Supply Chain.
Ongoing training and professional development to support your career growth
A range of fantastic Ventia employee benefits, including discounted private health insurance, paid parental leave, discounted travel, and more!

Key Responsibilities

Supply Chain Strategy & Solution Design

Lead the design and implementation of supply chain solutions that prioritize access to information and are aligned with business objectives, supplier capabilities, and system limitations.
Develop and deploy frameworks and models to optimize preferred supplier selection, supporting both category sourcing strategies and project delivery requirements.
Ensure supply chain solutions are aligned with broader business transformation initiatives and the organization's technology roadmap.

Project Leadership & Execution

Manage the full project lifecycle—from scoping and planning through to execution and post-implementation review.
Lead cross-functional project teams, ensuring clearly defined roles, responsibilities, and accountability.
Proactively identify and mitigate risks related to transitioning technical environments and supplier dependencies.

Data-Driven Decision Making

Utilize advanced analytics to evaluate supply chain performance, identify inefficiencies, and anticipate future demand.
Design and implement reporting tools that deliver actionable insights to senior leadership.
Translate complex data into clear, strategic recommendations that enhance business agility and resilience.

Stakeholder Engagement & Change Leadership

Collaborate closely with key internal stakeholders—particularly in supply chain, finance, and project teams—to co-develop effective solutions.
Facilitate workshops and design sessions to align on priorities, define solution pathways, and build consensus.
Lead change management initiatives to drive the successful adoption of new systems, processes, and ways of working.

Could You Be Our Senior Supply Chain Solutions Lead?

Hold extensive experience in supply chain strategy, project execution, or supplier enablement.
Demonstrated success in navigating complex and evolving technical environments.
Strong proficiency in ERP systems such as SAP or Oracle (critical), with experience in data analytics tools like Power BI or Tableau, and working knowledge of SQL (preferred).
Professional certification in Project Management (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) or Lean Six Sigma is advantageous.
Background in solution architecture or large-scale supply chain transformation initiatives.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management capabilities.
Proven ability to lead through ambiguity and deliver results in fast-paced, dynamic settings.
Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Business, Engineering, or a related field is beneficial.

About Ventia

Ventia is a leading infrastructure services company, operating across Australia and New Zealand. Our clients are the owners and operators of assets that are critical to our local communities. We pride ourselves on working smart, safely and sustainably, harnessing the latest technologies and brightest minds. With a diverse and proud heritage, we have a track record of delivering essential services to the communities in which we operate.

Diversity

Ventia is enriched by the diverse experiences, talents and cultures that our people bring to the organisation, while celebrating and respecting the communities we operate in. We are committed to providing a safe and positive environment that provides equal opportunities for individuals of all backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGBTQIA+, Women, Veterans and spouses and people with disabilities.

How to apply

If you are looking to expand your career with a business that rewards and values its employees, please apply below by clicking on the apply now button.

Position Reference Number: 164637

Bengalla Mining Company (a member of New Hope Group) is a joint venture with a strong track record of achievement. Our focus is on maintaining strong safety, productivity, and profitability results. We have a very collaborative team culture and a highly professional and rewarding work environment. Operational since 1999, Bengalla is in Muswellbrook in the Hunter Valley, and supplies international markets with approximately 13 Mtpa.

Bengalla is an open pit coal mine offering a residential lifestyle. The development consent for the operation provides the ability to mine through to 2039. We pride ourselves on the professionalism with which we pursue our goals and our strong links into our community.

The Role

We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Financial Analyst to join the Bengalla Commercial team on a Permanent, Fulltime basis.

Reporting to the Commercial Manager, you will be responsible for:

The annual business plan and regular reforecasting processes
Capital management and providing guidance to internal stakeholders
Leadership of the site Business Improvement function including investment analysis
Business risk management based on value enhancement
Insurance management and co-ordination of renewals
Liaising with senior management team and wider business

In this role, you will also provide Bengalla Mine management with analysis of strategic business options and reasoned recommendations for business enhancement.

Qualifications and experience

To be successful, you will need:

Commercial or Accounting qualifications (CPA or CA well regarded)
Mining industry experience
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills
Ability to work in a small friendly team
Focus on continuous improvement and value creation
Experience with Pulse ERP and Xeras modelling software is desirable but not essential


What We Offer  
Bengalla values its people and their contribution to the operation. Our well-established employee benefits program offers choice and flexibility to enhance the lifestyle and wellbeing of our team. With benefits including subsidised health insurance, salary packaging, self-education assistance and gym memberships we make the health, safety, and well-being of our people our absolute priority.
  
This is a great opportunity to join the professional and friendly team at Bengalla Mining Company and opportunities such as this are few within the region.

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below.

About the Role

As the Senior Manager, you will lead the development and execution of the organisation’s data and analytics roadmap, ensuring alignment with strategic priorities. You will mentor and develop a team of Analysts, fostering a culture of technical excellence and continuous learning, while championing data-driven decision-making across the business. A key part of the role is to translate complex data findings into clear insights for non-technical stakeholders and collaborate closely with Data Scientists, Engineers, and Technology teams to deliver innovative solutions.

You will also be responsible for building scalable data pipelines and cloud-based analytics solutions, ensuring accuracy, integrity, and compliance with regulatory standards. The role requires expertise in data modelling, ETL, governance, and cloud platforms, alongside proven leadership in managing technical teams and complex projects. By engaging with the Executive Team, Heads of Departments, and external vendors, you’ll provide strategic insights on emerging data technologies while ensuring best practices and compliance within the financial services environment.

As the Senior Manager within the Data Engineer team, you will report to the Head of Analytics Innovation.

Your responsibilities will be; but are not limited to;

Lead the development and execution of the analytics roadmap aligned with strategic priorities.
Mentor and develop a team of Data Analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and technical excellence.
Champion data-driven decision-making across the organisation.
Translate complex data findings into compelling stories for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with Data Scientists, Engineers, and Technology teams to deliver innovative solutions.
Drive data governance, quality, and compliance with regulatory standards.
Provide strategic insights into emerging data technologies and methodologies.
Key Responsibilities

Build scalable data pipelines and cloud-based analytics solutions.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency.
Develop and enforce best practices for data analysis.
Maintain compliance with financial services data handling and privacy standards.
Engage with internal stakeholders including the Executive Team, Heads of Departments, and external vendors.
About You
You'll bring:

A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Engineering, or related field.
7+ years' experience in data engineering, data management, or analytics.
Proven leadership in managing technical teams and complex projects.
Expertise in data modeling, ETL, warehousing, and governance.
Proficiency in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and CI/CD tools (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions).
Strong communication skills and the ability to influence across all levels of the organisation.
About Us

Teachers Mutual Bank Limited is one of the largest mutual banks in Australia. We are a globally-recognised socially responsible bank with profit-for-purpose as our businessmodel and philosophy. At our Bank, social responsibility is built-in, not bolted on and drives our business practices, people, and products.
  
We are proud to serve some of Australia's essential workers in education, emergency services and healthcare. We believe they deserve a bank that does good for their community.
  
We have been named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for ten years in a row and are a Certified B Corp Bank.

Our employees embrace our organisation's values of passion, advocacy and sustainability, and contribute to a diverse and inclusive workplace culture founded on mutual respect, equality and a focus on striving to deliver exceptional member service.
  
We work under a hybrid working model to provide flexibility in the workplace. For more information about working conditions as well as our employee value proposition, please visit the careers page on our website at www.tmbank.com.au or find us on LinkedIn!

How to apply 

Please click the APPLY button and follow the prompts.
  
For a confidential conversation, please contact lflett@tmbl.com.au     
  
Teachers Mutual Bank Ltd may conduct a background or reference check (or both) as part of the recruitment process. By applying you agree to cooperate fully in those procedures and understand that an offer is subject to the satisfactory outcome of those checks, at the discretion of Teachers Mutual Bank Ltd.
